title: Customer Support Agent - Swedish speaking
description:
**🌍 Let's shape the future of recruitment together! 🌟**
 Teamtailor is an Employer Branding and an ATS SaaS platform used by over 8000 companies, with 200,000+ users in 90 countries worldwide. 🚀
   

  

 Being a part of Teamtailor means joining a dynamic, international tech company where you can make a significant impact on organizational growth. It's a fast-paced environment that encourages responsibility and, of course, having a lot of fun! 🥳
   

  

 Diversity is at the core of Teamtailor. We value team members with varied backgrounds and expertise. There are no standard profiles; everyone shares our vision and strives to contribute to our success.
   

  

******Now, we are expanding our Customer Support Department and seeking a Swedish-speaking Customer Support Agent based in our Stockholm HQ. 🎉******
 The CS Team on our company trip to Spain
   

  

 As a member of our Customer Support Team, you will be responsible for our most important communication with our existing users. We are renowned for providing exceptional customer service and aim to surpass our customers' expectations. Our commitment to quality is reflected in our average response time of 2 minutes and customer satisfaction rating (CSAT) of 98%.
   

  

 Our goal is to ensure an exceptional experience for every user, resulting in smiles all around. 🤩
   

  

**As a Part Of The Team, You Will**
* Provide outstanding customer service through various support channels, such as live chat (Intercom), email, and occasional outbound phone calls.
* Excel in solving technical problems and troubleshooting, collaborating closely with our skilled tech team to tackle even the most difficult cases.
* Advocate for customer feedback, ensuring it reaches our product development department for continuous improvement.
* Identify, verify, and report bugs to our tech team on behalf of our customers, and then keep them informed about the status of the solution.
* Create informative self-service materials to empower our customers further.
* Take the initiative to engage with customers, nurturing strong relationships and boosting overall satisfaction.


**As The Ideal Candidate**
* You are fluent in written and spoken Swedish and English, effortlessly communicating with precision and clarity.
* Your customer support journey is extensive, preferably in the SaaS industry.
* An analytical mindset drives you, always seeking insights and embracing continuous learning.
* You have a strong passion for solving technical puzzles, adeptly troubleshooting issues, and feeling comfortable with cutting-edge technology.
* You thrive on delivering exceptional service and possess top-notch tech proficiency.


**Your benefits as a Customer Support Agent at Teamtailor will include:**
* A comfortable work environment with a great work-life balance.
* Continuous skill development training.
* 25 days paid vacation.
* A friendly team and regular social events.
* A starter kit that includes a MacBook, iPhone, and Teamtailor swag!


 Let's team up to build a customer experience that stands out globally. Are you ready to make a real impact? 🌟
   

  

******The position is based out of our Stockholm Office.******

title: Head of Operations Nordics
Nordic Senior Commercial Contract Manager
description:
Joining the
 **Nordic Commercial Contract Management team** 
 places you in a pivotal role, where you'll drive our business growth by offering expert commercial support to our teams and collaborating with clients to secure new and extended contracts.
 



  





 We work with a variety of stakeholders to help ensure that risks and commercial best practices are considered throughout sales cycles and applied end-to-end during the service delivery. Our team plays a key role in the pre-sales process, as we shape and sign deals to ensure that services are delivered according to the contract. We support with contract compliance and optimization in the delivery phase.
 



  





**YOUR ROLE** 




  




* Be a member of a bid team or an account team, taking a key role in the ongoing development of commercial and contractual matters.
* Be responsible for promoting commercial best practices during client engagement to drive value for our clients.
* Support large and complex sales opportunities (Bids, RFPs, RFQs).
* Participate in and lead senior level negotiations with internal/external customers and subcontractors for commercial contract matters.
* Act as the single point of contact for commercial matters.



  





**YOUR PROFILE** 




  




* 7+ years of experience in commercial contract management regarding large and complex contracts/accounts or similar experience.
* Detailed understanding of key legal, commercial principles and obligations found in IT services or outsourcing contracts.
* Proactive problem-solving skills, strong numeracy skills and understanding of finances.
* Contract drafting skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills, fluent Swedish and English.
* Certificate in Commercial and Contract Management from World Commerce and Contracting Association (WorldCC previously known as IACCM) is a plus.



  





**WHAT WE BELIEVE YOY WILL ENJOY ABOUT WORKING HERE** 




  




* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training and a global network of experts.
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness.
* A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person.
* An innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success.



  





**APPLICATION** 




  





 Don’t hesitate to send in your application. We will be interviewing continuously and look forward to finding our next colleague.

title: IT Tutor for children at KIBERone Cyberschool
description:
**Company Description** 




 KIBERone Sweden, located in Stockholm, is part of the first international programming school for children, KIBERone, which offers training courses on the basics of programming for children and teenagers aged 6 to 14 years. KIBERone has received worldwide recognition at UN and UNESCO competitions, becoming a world champion in digital education for children. Operating in 32 countries and over 300 cities, KIBERone Cyber School is a leading project in digital education for children.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 This is a part-time on-site role as an IT Tutor for children at KIBERone Cyberschool. The IT Tutor will teach and train children on Information Technology, and other related subjects to enhance their skills and knowledge in the field.
 



  





**We offer:** 



* Employment during weekends;
* A modern, in-demand, and relevant IT product for children;
* Methodological materials with detailed instructions for each lesson.
* Flexible working hours,
 
 possibility to combine with main employment or university
* Fun working environment;
* Convenient location in the center of Stockholm
* Working hours: 10:00 AM to 4:30 PM Saturday, Sunday (optional one day or both days)



  





**Qualifications** 



* Practical experience in development
* Knowledge of a modern programming language;
* Experience working with children is an advantage.
* Ability to communicate technical concepts in an easily understandable manner
* Passion for education and working with young learners
* Patience, creativity, and empathy in engaging students
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills



  





**Additional information:** 




  





 KIBERone is a large project developing in the USA and Europe to create and develop a system of modern innovative platforms for children and teenagers' intellectual development and leisure.
 


* The largest international project in IT for children aged 6 to 14 years.
* Strategic and systematic thinking is actively developed.
* Representative offices in 300 cities in 32 countries around the world.
* In 2020, UNESCO recognized KIBERone as the best digital education center for children.
* The European Association of Higher Education Teachers (HiSTES) recognized KIBERone as the best IT project in children's education.
* Collaborates with Samsung, Roblox Family Education Partner & Member.
* Qualified by Microsoft Corporation.
* Small groups - up to 12 people.

title: Pre Collection Agent
description:
Are you passionate about delivering exceptional customer experience to entrepreneurs? If yes, we are looking for a
 **Pre Collection Agent** 
 to join us transforming the banking industry.
   

  

**About Froda:**
 Froda was founded in 2015 with a clear vision – to revolutionize the banking experience for entrepreneurs by making it easy and affordable to invest in their ideas. We are challenging the old non-transparent and unfair ways by making capital accessible to more entrepreneurs.
   

  

**The role:**
 As a Pre Collection Agent, we work with customer experience and act proactively to find solutions together with the customer. Therefore, it's essential that you can build trust and understand the customer's needs.
   

  

 You must have excellent communication skills and the ability to handle sensitive conversations and data, and create individual solutions to succeed.
   

  

 The phone will largely be your primary tool, so it's important that you are comfortable in communicating with customers.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Problem-solving on a daily basis to support our customers in finding solutions.
* Assist our customers with various payment solutions.
* Actively participate in developing processes and contribute to the ongoing enhancement of our internal pre-collection function.


**To be a great fit we are seeking someone with**
* Fluency in Swedish and English. It is beneficial if you are proficient in additional languages, such as Finnish, Danish, or Arabic.
* Collection experience.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and be able to multitask effectively.
* Problem-solving skills with attention to details.
* Tech savvy: You need to be comfortable in working with various software and systems to support our customers.


**Why Froda?**
 Working at Froda means working at a company that combines the best of both worlds – fun and fast-paced culture, yet stable and structured. We are 90+ ambitious self-starters who genuinely care for each other and the work we do, while having fun together. You will have the ability to impact your own work and that the only thing standing between you and your goals is going to be your own ambitions.
   

  

 Furthermore, you’ll get:
   

  

* Fabulous office overlooking Stockholm and a friendly culture that values work/life balance
* Fun & exciting work environment in a fast-growing and profitable scale-up
* Competitive compensation package
* Insurance and pension plan

title: Field Service Engineer Image Guided Therapy
description:
**Job Title**
 Field Service Engineer Image Guided Therapy
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a
 **Field Service Engineer** 
 , you will mostly work in the customer’s environment, focusing on our popular and modern systems and devices within Image Guided Therapy. These include Azurion, FlexArm, Intrasight, Hemo, Zenition series, and our LumiGuide/FORS technology.
   

  

 This role primarily covers Västra Götaland, Östergötland, Stockholm, Örebro, and Värmland. You’ll also travel beyond this area as part of the Swedish and Nordic service team.
   

  

**Your role:**
* Executing service activities such as Field Change Order, preventative maintenance, emergency service, faultfinding, upgrades, installations and modifications, according to the relevant Philips’ quality standard policies
* To have a holistic view of the system and it´s functional environment, with an eye for functions from both a technical and user perspective.
* Responsible for completeness and accuracy of service records with particular attention to test & verification results
* Timely and accurate submission of service data, job sheets, field problem reports and other relevant administrative tasks as assigned
* Responsible for using appropriate measurement equipment both, electronic and analog in a regular controlled cycle of calibration.
* Report customer feedback and follow-up relevant assigned quality & regulatory training in a timely manner.
* Serve as company liaison with customer on administrative and technical matters.


**You're the right fit if** 
**you have the following:**
* Relevant educational background within medical/electrical engineering – or similar.
* Experience within field service preferably within a hospital environment.
* Good at identifying and maintaining customer relationships and related contacts.
* Independent and service-minded with a logical and methodical approach to problem solving.
* Understanding of mechanical contexts within functions and technical systems.
* Structured, organized mindset with a high level of personal integrity and self-discipline.
* Fluent written and verbal in English and Swedish language – is a must have
* Driving license (Swedish B) and willingness to travel.


**How We Work Together**
 We believe that we are better together than apart.
   

  

 Field roles are most effectively done outside of the company’s main facilities, generally at the customers’ or suppliers’ locations.
   

  

**About Philips**
 We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.
   

  

* Learn more about our business.
* Discover our rich and exciting history.
* Learn more about our purpose.


 If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.

title: Observability Engineer (Logging & Monitoring)
description:
Vill du jobba med Observability? Det går utöver monitorering och ger insikter i varför problem uppstår och hur de kan lösas. Bli Observability Engineer hos oss och utvecklas i ett innovativt team!
   

  

 Vi söker nu en engagerad och driven Observability Engineer som vill vara med och skapa framtidens molnlösningar! Hos oss kommer du att spela en viktig roll i vår tekniska utveckling och bidra till att säkerställa att våra system fungerar sömlöst.
   

  

 I denna roll kommer du att vara en del av vårt Azure Core Team, där du arbetar med att driva och implementera observability-lösningar för våra plattformar. Du kommer att ha ett stort ansvar för att utveckla strategier för loggning, monitorering och automatisering i våra Azure-miljöer. Din roll är viktig för att vi ska kunna identifiera potentiella problem i tid, säkerställa hög tillgänglighet och förhindra driftstörningar.
   

  

**Du kommer:**
* Driva och implementera observability-lösningar för våra Azure-miljöer.
* Utveckla och optimera strategier för loggning och monitorering.
* Implementera Infrastructure as Code (IaC) för observabilitykonfigurationer.
* Använda verktyg som Dynatrace, Azure Monitor, Log Analytics och Kusto Query Language (KQL).
* Stötta molnmigrationer och hybridlösningar med observability-principer.


**Du har:**
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med observability och monitoreringslösningar inom Azure.
* God förståelse för Dynatrace, Azure Monitor, Log Analytics, Application Insights och KQL.
* Kompetens inom CI/CD och DevOps-kultur.
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code (IaC)-verktyg som Bicep eller ARM Templates.
* Certifieringar som Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert eller liknande är meriterande.


**Vem är du?**
 Du har en passion för teknik och en vilja att vara med och skapa den bästa möjliga plattformen för våra digitala tjänster. Du är proaktiv, analytisk och älskar att hitta lösningar som gör systemen mer robusta och tillförlitliga.
   

  

**💚 Human IT**
 Human IT handlar om att göra saker lite annorlunda, att på riktigt sätta våra anställda i fokus. Vi växer tillsammans och värdesätter engagemang och ambition. För oss är det viktigt att du får chansen att vara med och påverka vägen framåt.
   

  

 I utbyte erbjuder vi kompetens- och karriärutveckling genom varierande och utmanande uppdrag. Vi är inte branschinriktade och kan därför erbjuda en fantastisk variation bland uppdragen för dig som konsult. Självklart ser vi till att du får rätt utbildning och vi är väl medvetna om att det är det livslånga lärandet som bygger vår framgång.
   

  

 Tillsammans skapar vi framtiden 🚀
   

  

* Tillsvidareanställning med fast månadslön
* Kollektivavtal
* Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning, inklusive maxat friskvårdsbidrag
* Utvecklingsplan
* Hälsoförsäkring + pension
* Förskottssemester


**Start** 
 : Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare.
   

  

**Plats** 
 : Stockholm med möjlighet till hybridarbete
   

  

**Ansökan** 
 : Vi rekryterar löpande. Så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

*Human IT arbetar tillsammans med Great Place To Work för att vi skall bli Sveriges bästa arbetsplats.*
**Och förresten:**
*Som en aktiv del i ett samhälle med kulturell och social mångfald är Human IT’s ambition att präglas av inkludering och bred representation, samt vara en arbetsplats med lika möjligheter för alla. Human IT anställer, bibehåller, befordrar och i övrigt behandlar alla medarbetare och kandidater efter erfarenhet, kvalifikationer och kompetens, oavsett kön, religion, ursprung, ålder, sexuell läggning, könsidentitet eller funktionsvariationer.*

title: Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset söker Data Scientist till AI-teamet
description:
Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset, Stab Vårdstöd och Teknik
 



  





*Vill du göra skillnad på riktigt varje dag? Hos oss får du vara med och bygga framtidens vårdsystem!* 




  





**Du erbjuds** 



* en meningsfull och utmanande roll i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö
* stort utrymme för personlig och professionell utveckling
* ett stöttande och inkluderande arbetsklimat med ett starkt fokus på samarbete och innovation
* möjligheten att arbeta på ett av världens bästa sjukhus med vård i framkant.



  





 Självklart får du också ta del av våra generella förmåner som Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset erbjuder dig.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Karolinska Universitetssjukhusets uppdrag är att bedriva specialiserad och högspecialiserad sjukvård. Vår vision ”Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag” är vägledande när vi arbetar mot tydliga värden för patienter och samhälle och mot medicinska framsteg.
 



  





 En förutsättning för nästa steg inom den medicinska utvecklingen är förbättrade och moderniserade informationsstrukturer och digitalisering där vi i allt större utsträckning styr produktion och vårdleverans datadrivet och med digital information som beslutsstöd.
 



  





 Karolinska har en stark IT-avdelning och ska nu etablera ett AI-team som till en början kommer bestå av fyra personer. Syftet är att ge oss förmåga att i partnerskap och på egen hand utveckla helt nya lösningar för vårdens digitala system som idag inte finns på marknaden. Vi har stor erfarenhet och kunskap inom vårdens traditionella system men vi behöver bli fler som tänker nytt och som utmanar desamma. Ambition, leveransfokus och kreativitet värdesätts högt och vi behöver både bredd och spets och vi ser gärna att även talanger med mindre erfarenhet växer med oss.
 



  





 Som Data Scientist blir du en del av Karolinskas IT-avdelning och arbetar i vårt nybildade AI-team, vars uppdrag är att utveckla AI-lösningar som skapar verkligt värde för vår verksamhet. Teamet tillämpar agila arbetsmetoder och DevOps-principer. Du får möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö med hög kompetens och vara med och skapa lösningar som inte existerar någonstans idag. Du kommer jobba nära vårdens professioner och i ett sammanhang som rör sig snabbt och med stor variation.
 



  





 Vi söker nu en Data Scientist som, i samarbete med verksamheten, kan använda sin pedagogiska och tekniska förmåga för att förse vården med data och beslutsunderlag. Genom att omvandla data till insikter får vi möjligheten att leverera mer exakta prognoser, beslutstöd för hälso- och sjukvården, optimera produktion, syna sammanhang som ger vårdens personal bättre underlag för rådgivning och beslut och öka tryggheten. Och mycket mer!
 



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* kan arbeta självständigt såväl som i team
* är empatisk och lyhörd för patienters och kollegors behov
* är nyfiken, kommunikativ och samarbetsvillig
* är engagerad och lösningsorienterad
* trivs när det är full fart och gillar att söka ny kunskap.



  





 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




*Krav:* 



* Data Scientist med ett till flera års erfarenhet.
* Relevant akademisk utbildning inom data science, statistik, eller ett liknande ämne med fokus på kvantitativ analys.
* Erfarenhet av att använda SQL för att extrahera data.
* Erfarenhet av programmering i språk som Python, R eller liknande.
* Kunskap om maskininlärning, AI och statistiska analysmetoder.
* Stark problemlösningsförmåga och analytiskt tänkande.
* Ett genuint intresse för att förbättra sjukvården och upplevelsen hos patienter och anställda.
* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig både muntligt och skriftligt på svenska och engelska.
* Kunna effektivt ta fram och genomföra kvantitativa och kvalitativa analyser och kommunicera resultat på ett tydligt och strukturerat sätt anpassat till målgruppen.



  





*Meriterande:* 



* Erfarenhet av visualiseringsverktyg som Power BI, Qlik eller Tableau.
* Erfarenhet av verktyg som TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain, eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet av datamodellering.



  





**Om rekryteringsprocessen** 




 Urval och intervjuer sker fortlöpande under ansökningstiden och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas.
 



  





**För att din ansökan ska vara komplett ska den innehålla:** 



1. CV
2. Utbildningsbevis
3. Personligt brev (frivilligt)



  





*Varmt välkommen med din ansökan - Tillsammans är vi Karolinska!* 




  





 Inför tillsättning av befattning som innefattar vård av barn och ungdom, kontrolleras den som erbjuds tjänsten mot misstanke- och belastningsregistret. Här kan du läsa mer om rekryteringsprocessen och om vilka kontroller som utförs på Karolinska.
 



  





 Som anställd på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset kan du komma att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om vad det innebär här.
 



  





 Om du är eller tidigare har varit anställd i Region Stockholm kommer vi att ta interna referenser från din nuvarande eller tidigare chef, om du blir aktuell för anställning.
 



  





**Om Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset** 




 Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.
 



  





 Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.
 



  





 Läs gärna mer om oss på karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!
 



  





**Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm** 




 Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar.
 



  





 Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
 



  





 Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen.
 



  





 Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion.
 



  





 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
 



  





 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning
 



 Anställningens omfattning: Heltid
 



 Tillträde: Enligt Överenskommelse
 



 Löneform: Månadslön
 



 Antal lediga befattningar: 2
 



 Sysselsättningsgrad: 100%
 



 Ort: Stockholm
 



 Län: Stockholms län
 



 Land: Sverige
 



 Referensnummer: 2025/245
 



 Kontakt:
 


* Espen Sigvardsen, 0708454218



 Facklig företrädare:
 


* SACO, saco.karolinska.karolinska@regionstockholm.se



 Publicerat: 2025-01-13
 



 Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-02-13

title: Global Account Manager (GAM) - EU
description:
**Job Description**
**Company** 
 :
   

  

 Cogent Communications is a multinational, Tier 1 facilities-based ISP, consistently ranked as one of the top five networks in the world and is publicly traded on the NASDAQ Stock Market under the ticker symbol CCOI. Cogent specializes in providing businesses with high speed Internet access, Ethernet transport services and is one of the only US providers who own and operate their own fibre infrastructure spanning the US for diverse Wave connectivity. Cogent's facilities-based, all-optical IP network backbone provides IP services in over 235 markets globally. Since its inception, Cogent has unleashed the benefits of IP technology, building one of the largest and highest capacity IP networks in the world. This network enables Cogent to offer large bandwidth connections at highly competitive prices. Cogent also offers superior customer support by virtue of its end-to-end control of service delivery and network monitoring.
   

  

**Position Overview:**
 The Global Account Manager is responsible for identifying and securing new business opportunities globally. By employing consultative selling techniques and relationship-building strategies, you will work directly with the nation’s leading IT Decision Makers to position Cogent's connectivity solutions. This role involves proactive outreach through direct calling, email, and onsite meetings, with a strong focus on understanding clients' current and future connectivity needs. Success in this position will be measured by meeting or exceeding monthly revenue goals and establishing Cogent as a trusted partner across commercial and retail buildings, carrier-neutral hotels, data centers, and colocation facilities.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Identify, qualify, and secure new business opportunities within a global sales territory, focusing on market segments who require IP transit, Wave connectivity, Ethernet, Colocation and IPv4 services.
* Use direct calling, email outreach, and customer meetings to connect with Key Decision Makers and generate new business opportunities.
* Employ consultative and relationship-driven sales approaches to identify prospective clients’ current and future connectivity needs.
* Position Cogent’s services as the preferred choice by leveraging our extensive global network footprint, which spans commercial and retail buildings, carrier-neutral hotels, data centers, and colocation facilities.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure customer needs are met and expectations exceeded.
* Maintain and update detailed records of sales activities in CRM systems, tracking progress, and managing customer relationships.


**Qualifications** 
 :
   

  

* Telesales experience in any industry, with B2B sales experience being an advantage
* Proven ability to identify, qualify, and generate new business opportunities through proactive prospecting and research.
* Strong communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to engage effectively with Key Decision Makers.
* Self-motivated, positive, and proactive, with a passion for adding value to clients and excelling in a competitive, revenue-driven environment.
* Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, team-oriented and competitive environment with revenue-driven goals and rewards.
* Familiarity with CRM systems and basic proficiency in Microsoft Office are beneficial.
* Telecommunications experience or knowledge of connectivity solutions is advantageous but not essential.
* Cogent operates a global sales model so foreign language skills are an advantage


**Work Environment:**
 This is an in-office position, five days a week, designed to support your success through focused mentorship, training, and personal coaching.
   

  

 To apply for the Global Account Manager position, please submit your resume and cover letter to careers@cogentco.com .
   

  

 Cogent Communications is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Product Manager Modernization
description:
ASSA ABLOY Entrance Systems, in its Business Segment Industrial (BSI), looks forward to filling the exciting **Product Manager - Modernization** role for Europe. The European business model covers the supply chain, sales, installation, and service. BSI delivers solutions in the following main product areas: Industrial Doors, Dock Levelers, High-Performance Doors, and Megadoors. The scope of the European service business is around EUR 460 million, with 2000 employees.  


**What do we do?**
The Service organization within BSI Europe develops and delivers solutions for the industrial service market, including maintenance, repairs, and equipment upgrades. BSI Europe Service is now advancing a Modernization business to provide sustainable, connected solutions that enhance and integrate customers' industrial doors, ensuring efficiency and an excellent user experience.  


**Who are we looking for?**
The ***Product Manager - Modernization*** is responsible for defining, developing, and executing the product strategy for modernization initiatives to upgrade and transform all industrial door systems, related processes, and solutions. This role requires a deep understanding of emerging technologies, market trends, and customer needs to deliver innovative and impactful modernization products successfully. Having good product knowledge of OHSD, HPD, and MEGA doors of ASSA ABLOY or competitors will be an advantage. The Product Manager is the central coordination point, collaborating with cross-functional teams to align product development with organizational goals and customer expectations.  


The role reports to head of Service Europe and could be located in Europe with preference for Sweden (Malmö/Landskrona), The Netherlands (Heerhugowaard) or in Germany.  


**Key Responsibilities**
1. Product Strategy and Roadmap
* Develop and execute the product roadmap for modernization initiatives in alignment with business objectives.
* Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and stakeholder interviews to identify opportunities for modernization.
* Define product vision and strategy, focusing on replacing outdated systems with scalable, efficient, and innovative solutions.

  


2. Product Development
* Collaborate with engineering, design, equipment product units, sales companies, service and operational teams to create modernization products that address user pain points and deliver measurable value.
* Write detailed product requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria for development teams.
* Ensure that modernization products leverage emerging technologies like AI, cloud computing, and automation.

  


3. Lifecycle Management
* Manage the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to development, launch, and ongoing optimization.
* Monitor product performance using key metrics and feedback to identify areas for improvement and ensure long-term success.
* Develop transition plans for legacy systems to minimize disruption during modernization efforts.

  


4. Stakeholder Collaboration
* Act as a liaison between customers, internal teams, and executive leadership to align product goals with business priorities.
* Present updates on modernization product progress, including risks, milestones, and successes, to key stakeholders.
* Partner with marketing and sales teams to define go-to-market strategies for modernization solutions.

  


5. Customer-Focused Design
* Advocate for end-users by incorporating customer feedback into product design and development.
* Ensure modernization products enhance the user experience, reduce operational inefficiencies and improve overall business outcomes.

  


6. Emerging Technology Integration
* Stay informed about the latest technological advancements and evaluate their applicability to modernization efforts.
* Lead initiatives incorporating cutting-edge tools and techniques, such as robotic process automation (RPA), machine learning, and IoT.

  


7. Performance Measurement
* Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of modernization initiatives contributing to profitable service growth.
* Use data-driven insights to prioritize development efforts and make informed decisions. o Prepare detailed performance reports for internal and external stakeholders.

  


**Required Skills and Qualifications**  


Education:
* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* A master’s degree or MBA is a plus.

  


Experience:
* 5+ years of product management experience, preferably focusing on modernization, digital transformation, or technology-driven initiatives.
* Proven track record of managing modernization projects, such as system upgrades, platform migrations, or process optimization.

  


Skills:
* Strong knowledge of modernization technologies, including AI, cloud platforms, RPA, and data analytics.
* Expertise in product management methodologies, agile development practices, and user-centered design principles.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and drive decisions based on insights.
* Strong organizational and project management abilities, with attention to detail and a focus on results

  


**Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)*** Successful delivery of modernization products within budget and timelines.
* Adoption rates and user satisfaction levels of modernization solutions.
* Reduction in operational inefficiencies or costs through product implementation.
* Achievement of service growth and market share growth driven by modernization initiatives.
* Positive feedback from internal and external stakeholders.

  


**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait**
We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply, no later than 12th February 2025.
To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post.  


**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**  

Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
company_description: Let’s create a safer and more open world – together!

title: Solution Designer (Asset Analytics)
description:
Tillsvidareanställning hos JP IT-Konsult i Stockholm AB – Uppdrag i Stockholm (hybrid: 2 dagar på kontoret, 3 dagar på distans)
  
Om företaget
  
JP IT-Konsult i Stockholm AB är ett konsultbolag som samarbetar med ledande aktörer inom energisektorn och andra spännande branscher. Vi strävar efter att erbjuda våra konsulter stimulerande uppdrag där de får möjlighet att utvecklas i en högteknologisk och innovativ miljö. Nu söker vi en Solution Designer med fokus på data- och analyslösningar för ett uppdrag där du blir en nyckelspelare i att forma och optimera framtidens analysplattformar.
  
Arbetsuppgifter
  
I rollen som Solution Designer inom Asset Analytics kommer du att:
  
Samordna lösningsdesignen inom flera agila team, i samråd med dataexperter och övriga lösningsarkitekter i organisationen.
  
Säkerställa att föreslagna tekniska lösningar (t.ex. Databricks, Data Factory, SnowFlake) är i linje med verksamhetens arkitekturprinciper.
  
Stötta teamens Data Engineers med riktlinjer för arkitektur, utveckling och implementering av analyslösningar.
  
Utveckla och optimera processer för ETL, Data Warehousing och datamodellering i Azure-miljö.
  
Handleda Lead Data Engineers i arkitekturarbete, med målet att de gradvis tar över ansvaret för lösningsdesign.
  
  

Kvalifikationer (Ska-krav)
  
  

**Vi söker dig som har:**  

Erfarenhet av Power BI, Databricks, Data Factory, SSIS och SnowFlake.
  
Gedigna kunskaper inom ETL, API-hantering samt Data Warehousing & datamodellering (stjärnscheman).
  
Praktisk erfarenhet av IT-arkitektur, inklusive arbete med guidelines och principer för arkitektur.
  
Kunskap i SQL, PostgreSQL, PowerShell, GIT och CI/CD för versionshantering och automatisering.
  
Förtrogenhet med Azure Cloud Framework och Azure Synapse Workspace.
  
God kommunikationsförmåga i tal och skrift (CV endast på engelska, enligt kundens önskemål).
  
  

Meriterande (Bra att ha)
  
Power Apps-vana.
  
Erfarenhet av att leda eller coacha agila team inom data- och analysprojekt.
  
Intresse för energisektorn och tillhörande affärslogik.
  
  

Ansökan
  
Är du redo för en spännande roll där du får forma framtidens analyslösningar och dela med dig av din kunskap? Skicka din ansökan (CV och en kort motivering) till info@jpitkonsult.se och ange ”Solution Designer (Asset Analytics) - 12390” i ämnesraden. Vi arbetar med löpande urval, så skicka gärna din ansökan snarast!
  
(Detta är en tillsvidareanställning hos JP IT-Konsult i Stockholm AB, där du arbetar heltid hos kunden från 3 mars 2025 till 30 september 2025. Rollen är hybrid med närvaro på kontoret i Stockholm två dagar i veckan och möjlighet att arbeta på distans övriga dagar.)
  
Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Cyber Security
description:
Noor Engineering
  
Noor Engineering was founded 2015.
  
  

**Vision:**  

Noor Engineering helps individuals and organizations to achieve success
  
  

**Strategy:**  

We target excellence in everything we do. We are brave to work creatively with innovate solutions. We work with instant improvements and prioritize learning. We don’t compete with low price, we compete with maximizing added value.
  
Our Services
  
Our consultants have experience in world class in the Automotive and Railway industries. We offer consultants in Testing, Test management, Software development, Project Management and Agile couching.
  
Today’s software development and testing environments are complex and challenging. Short delivery time scales, complex products to test and demanding customers. These challenges demand a well thought out project management practices and development and test way of working and smart test management practices.
  
One of the most important key success factors in any project is people skills. We offer solutions to strength people skills in testing, project management, SCRUM and agile testing.
  
  

Responsibilities and tasks
  
Plan and executed cybersecurity verification and validation (V&V) activities in projects.
  
Contribute to cybersecurity activities such as code review, vulnerability assessment/management
  
Contribute to the improvement of processes and guidelines in the area of cybersecurity V&V.
  
Contribute to the development and improvement of security coding principles and guidelines.
  
Support software and application developers both in-vehicle and cloud with cybersecurity related topics.
  
Contribute to increase awareness and knowledge about cybersecurity within the organization
  
  

**Requirements:**  

M.Sc. or B.Sc. in Electrical, Computer Engineering, IT or equivalent area
  
Proven relevant cybersecurity background and passion for cybersecurity
  
Hands-on and well-recognized experience of working in one or more of the following areas: penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, fuzz testing, code review, incident response/management. Beneficial to have experience with “Ethical Hacking”
  
Experience of working with Python/C/C++ as well as Linux and relevant Linux-based cybersecurity tools.
  
Knowledge about software engineering and relevant cybersecurity aspects from software perspective
  
Knowledge about cybersecurity best practices, standards and regulations, ISO21434 and R155
  
Beneficial to have experience of working with automotive electrical systems, architecture and/or software.
  
B driver license.
  
Valid work permit in Sweden.
  
  

**Additional information:**  

As part of our team, you will have access to training, certifications, and the possibility of working together with some of the most skilled in the industry
  
Everyone in our team has a high level of responsibility and mandate, and is expected to be able to work both as team player and autonomously

title: Verification Engineer
description:
**Description:**

Looking for a junior ( 0-5 years of experience) Electrical & Electronics engineer with interest in in Verification, vehicle diagnostics, fault tracing with possibility to work closely with dealers and internal and external workshops to coordinate and perform testing on vehicles, prototypes and HIL-rigs.

Highly meriting is having knowledge of Vector products (CANalayzer), CAN-protocol and experience within automotive.

**Main area of responsibility**

* Vehicle diagnostics & Fault tracing in rig and vehicles
* E2E testing Onboard and Offboard Connectivity
* Develop, write, preform and report test cases based on the requirements on system and vehicle level
* Securing quality and readiness before release

**And this is you**

* BSc or MSc degree in electrical/software engineering or equivalent is highly valuableInterest in verification area, vehicle or system rigs
* T-shaping mindset, experience or interest in learning new areas
* Knowledge of Tools: Vector tools and CAN-protocol

For any questions, please reach out to info@nilsbackman.se

Infotainment test engineer
  
As an Infotainment test engineer, you are responsible for the verification of the Infotainment system in the car together with a talented test Team in Noor Engineerings client organization. You will work closely to the Infotainment design team. Conduct system and function testing for the infotainment system. You will be reporting to the Infotainment test leader.
  
Responsibilities and tasks
  
Contribute to the implementation of agreed verification plans and test strategies for the Infotainment area
  
Performing system and function test on infotainment system applying different methods according to test strategy
  
Test case design and maintenance
  
Reporting test progress to the test leader and project team. But also identify and escalate verification risks to management
  
Contribute to a culture of improvement and participate in implementing improvements to increase effectiveness and efficiency
  
You are an ambassador for Noor Engineering and optimizing the added value for Noor Engineering and its clients
  
  

**Requirements:**  

B.Sc. Electrical or Computer Engineering or similar.
  
5 years experience in automotive & infotainment embedded systems development
  
Knowledge in CANoe and CAN/LIN/Flexray/Ethernet networks
  
Relevant experience of the infotainment area and of automotive test in vehicles
  
Driving license
  
Advantageously to be ISTQB Foundation - Certified
  
Advantageously to have experience in scripting and automation
  
High communication skills and high collaborations ability
  
  

**Additional information:**  

Each individual in our team has a high level of responsibility and mandate and is expected to be able to work both as a team player and autonomously
